title.english: The Idaten Deities Know Only Peace

description:
It has been 800 years since the incredibly fast and powerful gods of battle known as the Idaten had sealed away the demons after an intense battle. Now, that battle is just considered a myth or a fairytale. While the current generation of Idaten who have never even had to fight are enjoying their peaceful lives, someone awakened the demons once again! Armed forces, ingenuity. politics, and intrigue. If you've got it, use everything you can! This three-way battle royale with no rules and no limits is about to begin!!

(Source: Crunchyroll)
synonyms: Idaten Deities in the Peaceful Generation
อิดะเท็น เทพต่อสู้กู้ยุคสันติ

tags.name: Demons
tags.description: Prominently features malevolent otherworldly creatures.

tags.name: Gods
tags.description: Prominently features a character of divine or religious nature.

tags.name: War
tags.description: Partly or completely set during wartime.

tags.name: Gore
tags.description: Prominently features graphic bloodshed and violence.

tags.name: Super Power
tags.description: Prominently features characters with special abilities that allow them to do what would normally be physically or logically impossible.

tags.name: Philosophy
tags.description: Relating or devoted to the study of the fundamental nature of knowledge, reality, and existence.

tags.name: Tragedy
tags.description: Centers around tragic events and unhappy endings.

tags.name: Military
tags.description: Centered around the life and activities of military personnel.

tags.name: Seinen
tags.description: Target demographic is adult males.

tags.name: Surreal Comedy
tags.description: Prominently features comedic moments that defy casual reasoning, resulting in illogical events.

tags.name: Hypersexuality
tags.description: Portrays a character with a hypersexuality disorder, compulsive sexual behavior, or sex addiction.

tags.name: Anti-Hero
tags.description: Features a protagonist who lacks conventional heroic attributes and may be considered a borderline villain.

tags.name: Ensemble Cast
tags.description: Features a large cast of characters with (almost) equal screen time and importance to the plot.

tags.name: Satire
tags.description: Prominently features the use of comedy or ridicule to expose and criticise social phenomena.

tags.name: Memory Manipulation
tags.description: Prominently features a character(s) who has had their memories altered.

tags.name: Time Skip
tags.description: Features a gap in time used to advance the story.

tags.name: Religion
tags.description: Centers on the belief that humanity is related to supernatural, transcendental, and spiritual elements.

tags.name: Body Horror
tags.description: Features characters who undergo horrific transformations or disfigurement, often to their own detriment.

tags.name: Amputation
tags.description: Features amputation or amputees.

tags.name: Slapstick
tags.description: Prominently features comedy based on deliberately clumsy actions or embarrassing events.

tags.name: Nudity
tags.description: Features a character wearing no clothing or exposing intimate body parts.

tags.name: Rape
tags.description: Features non-consensual sexual penetration.

tags.name: Nun
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is a nun.

tags.name: Torture
tags.description: The act of deliberately inflicting severe pain or suffering upon another individual or oneself as a punishment or with a specific purpose.

tags.name: Masturbation
tags.description: Features erotic stimulation of one's own genitalia or other erogenous regions.

tags.name: CGI
tags.description: Prominently features scenes created with computer-generated imagery.

tags.name: Virginity
tags.description: Features a male character who has never had sexual relations (until now).

tags.name: Sex Toys
tags.description: Features objects that are designed to stimulate sexual pleasure.

node.description:
__[Website](https://tatsuyakitani.com/)__ | __[YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCgP3GbgbuVzAhlctGU5yuPA)__ | __[Twitter](https://twitter.com/tatsuyakitani)__ | __[Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/inunohone/)__

__Introduction:__
Tatsuya Kitani is a Japanese vocalist, bassist, guitarist, composer, arranger and programmer. He is also known as a Vocaloid song producer, going under the name Konnichiwa Tanita-san/Hello Tanita-san.

__Biography:__
Tatsuya started publishing music on the Internet around 2014. Later in 2017, he would start performing solo activities, while providing music as a lyricist. In 2018, he would form the band [Sajou no Hana](https://anilist.co/staff/137163) (stylized as sajou no hana) with members Sana and [Sho Watanabe](https://anilist.co/staff/109345).
Representative director of [Aniplex](https://anilist.co/studio/17/). Board Director at [CloverWorks](https://anilist.co/studio/6222/CloverWorks).

Began his career in animation at [Studio 4°C](https://anilist.co/studio/13/), where he worked on projects like [Genius Party Beyond](https://anilist.co/anime/6795/). In 2011, he was handpicked by then president [Masao Maruyama](https://anilist.co/staff/103170/) to join [Mappa](https://anilist.co/studio/569/) as a producer. He then went on to work as an animation producer on numerous titles such as [Kids on the Slope](https://anilist.co/anime/12531/), [Terror in Resonance](https://anilist.co/anime/20661/) and [Shingeki no Bahamut: Genesis](https://anilist.co/anime/20590/).

In April 2016, Maruyama handed Ootsuka the reigns of the studio and he took on the role of a producer and the CEO.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/Kimu777)

Makoto Kimura is an animation producer originally from Fuji TV Noitamina. He then moved to [Twin Engine](https://anilist.co/studio/6199/Twin-Engine) and later then to Studio [MAPPA](https://anilist.co/studio/569/MAPPA) where he was the Director of Planning Department. In April 2024, he left MAPPA and formed BLUE RIGHTS Co. Ltd.

_Note: Not to be confused with the background artist [Makoto Kimura](https://anilist.co/staff/182523/)._

Began his career in animation at [Studio 4°C](https://anilist.co/studio/13/), where he worked on projects like [Genius Party Beyond](https://anilist.co/anime/6795/). In 2011, he was handpicked by then president [Masao Maruyama](https://anilist.co/staff/103170/) to join [Mappa](https://anilist.co/studio/569/) as a producer. He then went on to work as an animation producer on numerous titles such as [Kids on the Slope](https://anilist.co/anime/12531/), [Terror in Resonance](https://anilist.co/anime/20661/) and [Shingeki no Bahamut: Genesis](https://anilist.co/anime/20590/).

In April 2016, Maruyama handed Ootsuka the reigns of the studio and he took on the role of a producer and the CEO.
Youko Matsuzaki is a producer at Fuji TV.
